intro: Tylophora minima, commonly known as the lesser trumpet vine, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its climbing habit and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are often clustered in inflorescences. Its leaves are simple, opposite, and usually oval in shape. Tylophora minima is also noted for its medicinal properties, with various parts of the plant used in traditional medicine.
